author: Special Correspondent
text:
Concerned about poor visibility and inaccessibility of e-seva centres, the Chennai Corporation and TACTV (Tamil Nadu Arasu Cable TV Corporation) will commission new signboards in each neighbourhood directing residents towards the 70 e-seva centres across the city.

“The nameboards will have electro cut film and retro-reflective sheets. The cost for erecting each signboard will be around Rs. 60,000,” said an official.

TACTV has established as many as 70 e-seva centres in Chennai Corporation offices.

Personnel manning the e-seva centres offer quick civic services such as Aadhaar cards, community certificates and property tax payment to residents. – Special Correspondent

The centres help residents get Aadhaar cards, community certificates and pay property tax
title: Signboards to lead the way to e-seva centres
